Ltd&#8217;s upcoming Wii U Zelda game won&#8217;t hit its originally announced 2015 release date, according to an update released today by series producer Eiji Aonuma.</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 19 Mar 2015 14:52:47 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10902768.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10787502</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Just+like+hockey+football+theScore+launches+eSports/10787502/story.html</link><title>theScore launches new eSports-focused app</title><description>On Wednesday Toronto-based media company theScore announced it&#8217;s launching a new eSports-focused mobile app and website, set to cover&#160;the growing professional gaming industry at the same level it reports on traditional sports. theScore&#8217;s audience has grown to over 10 million [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 04 Feb 2015 17:44:04 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10784119.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10781759</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Sony+Online+Entertainment+sold+management+firm+renamed/10781759/story.html</link><title>Sony Online Entertainment sold to management firm and renamed Daybreak Game Company</title><description>After almost 20 years, Sony Online Entertainment (SOE), the developer of EverQuest, Planetside, DC Universe Online and the recently released H1Z1, has been sold by Sony to an investment firm called Columbus Nova. After playing most of Telltale&#8217;s adventure game series I&#8217;ve been feeling burnt out on the genre lately, but the internet furor surrounding Life is Strange caught my attention. Still, even after reading a [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Tue, 03 Feb 2015 01:43:21 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10781595.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10775000</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Dying+Light+free+running+system+what+makes+game/10775000/story.html</link><title>Dying Light’s free running system is what makes the game compelling</title><description>After spending around six to eight hours with Techland&#8217;s latest zombie epic, Dying Light, I&#8217;ve realized the act of taking down zombies isn&#8217;t the most interesting part of the game &#8211; it&#8217;s the death defying leaps that stem from its [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Sat, 31 Jan 2015 04:46:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10775001.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10774282</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Sega+announces+over+cuts+company+restructures/10774282/story.html</link><title>Sega announces over 300 job cuts as the company restructures</title><description>On Friday Sega announced it has plans to cut as many as 300 jobs, offering many of those affected &#8220;early retirement,&#8221; which also includes severance packages, as the company restructures its business with a focus on PC and mobile games. [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 30 Jan 2015 22:25:24 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10774283.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10765208</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Microsoft+sells+million+Xbox+consoles+2014+makes/10765208/story.html</link><title>Microsoft sells 6.6 million Xbox consoles in Q4 2014, makes $26.5-billion</title><description>Microsoft has revealed it sold 6.6 million Xbox consoles during the fourth quarter of 2014, the shopping season leading up to Christmas, earning revenue totaling $26.5-billion. The tech giant&#8217;s total company income was $5.8-billion. Despite a rise in revenue, overall [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 28 Jan 2015 00:20:41 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10765209.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10775225</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Resident+Evil+killed+horror+games+best+possible/10775225/story.html</link><title>Resident Evil 4 killed horror games in the best way possible</title><description>The classic blend of action and horror gameplay is pretty much dead, and it&#8217;s all Resident Evil 4&#8217;s fault.</description><source>Technology - HoloLens aims to create an augmented reality experience that&#8217;s decidedly different from what the Oculus Rift and Sony&#8217;s Project Morpheus [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 22 Jan 2015 04:03:15 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10749004.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10748704</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Elegy+Dead+World+Review+Byron+Shelley+Blake+walk+into/10748704/story.html</link><title>Elegy for a Dead World Review: So Byron, Shelley, and Blake walk into a cemetery…</title><description>Imagine you&#8217;re floating, effortless and alone, in the deepest chasm of space. By now you&#8217;re numb to the cold, and the pastel, purple skies twirl with you as you tease the thrusters of your rocket pack. Surrounding you are working [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 22 Jan 2015 04:03:10 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10748705.png" type="image/png" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10745725</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Player+invents+level+Destiny+while+sleeping/10745725/story.html</link><title>Player invents way to level up in Destiny while sleeping</title><description>To participate in Destiny&#8217;s &#8220;end-game&#8221; leveling system, players need to invest a significant amount of time, and also hope they&#8217;re lucky enough to get their hands on rare weapons and items during random drops, but to get to make it [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 21 Jan 2015 20:44:27 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10745726.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10742179</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Evolve+preview+monster/10742179/story.html</link><title>Evolve preview: All for one, you monster</title><description>When Game Informer unveiled Left 4 Dead developer Turtle Rock&#8217;s new co-op shooter, Evolve, last February, I wasn&#8217;t very interested in the game. Players play against a&#160;huge monster, or assume the role of that monster and kill other players &#8211; [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jan 2015 21:55:36 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10742180.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10742079</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/JumpJet+review+radical+tribute/10742079/story.html</link><title>JumpJet Rex review: A radical ’90s tribute</title><description>Under Rex's radical, retro-inspired exterior there's a beating heart of modern game design, patterned after popular indie games like Super Meat Boy. Rex is only retro on the surface, and that's a great thing.</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jan 2015 21:52:56 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10742080.png" type="image/png" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10742333</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Kingdom+Hearts+Remix+review+Final+Fantasy+Disney+still/10742333/story.html</link><title>Kingdom Hearts HD II.5 Remix review: Final Fantasy and Disney is still a compelling mix</title><description>I was always weirded out by the concept of playing a Square Enix game featuring characters with spikey hair and the ability to cast elemental magic from their giant finger tips, alongside Disney characters. Donald Duck as a spell caster? [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jan 2015 23:53:29 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10742334.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10735747</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/five+most+interesting+features/10735747/story.html</link><title>The New 3DS’ six most interesting features</title><description>I&#8217;ve spent most of this week playing around with Nintendo&#8217;s latest handheld console, the New 3DS, and so far I&#8217;m impressed with the device. It solves a number of the issues I had with the original 3DS and also improves [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Sat, 17 Jan 2015 01:54:58 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10735748.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10735653</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Nintendo+best+sales+month+ever+December/10735653/story.html</link><title>Nintendo’s Wii U has its best sales month ever in December</title><description>On Friday Nintendo of America announced the sales of its struggling Wii U console have raised 29 per cent and that game sales for the console have gone up 75 per cent, when compared to December sales in 2013, resulting [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jan 2015 20:14:20 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10735654.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10732331</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Vancouver+Island+developed+game+Long+Dark+sells+more/10732331/story.html</link><title>Vancouver Island-developed game The Long Dark sells more than 250,000 copies</title><description>The Long Dark, an exploration-survival title set in the Canadian north, developed by Vancouver Island-based Hinterland Studio,&#160;has sold more than 250,000 copies since its Sept. 22 launch. The game is currently still in development but is available though Steam&#8217;s early-access [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 23:44:52 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10732332.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10732081</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Assassin+Creed+Unity+Dead+Kings+review+Arno+angsty/10732081/story.html</link><title>Assassin’s Creed Unity: Dead Kings review: Arno’s angsty adventure</title><description>Ubisoft&#8217;s latest Assassin&#8217;s Creed got off to a rough start. Frame rate glitches, server issues, and endless bugs hindered the game&#8217;s playability almost entirely. Despite the problems, there was a&#160;good game underneath Unity&#8217;s&#160;grime and Ubisoft has tried to fix the [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Mon, 19 Jan 2015 19:23:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10732082.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10731715</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/review+Silly+name+worthy+upgrade/10731715/story.html</link><title>New 3DS XL review: Silly name but a worthy upgrade</title><description>The New 3DS&#8217; name might be ridiculous, but thankfully the console is a significant upgrade over Nintendo&#8217;s original 3DS, released three and a half years ago ago&#160;in 2011. The console itself is a strange decision for Nintendo, effectively splintering the [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 19:43:52 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10731716.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10729439</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Toronto+YouTuber+VanossGaming+passing+Ellen+Justin/10729439/story.html</link><title>How Toronto YouTuber VanossGaming is passing Ellen, Justin Bieber in subscribers</title><description>Michael Oliveira TORONTO &#8212; Twenty-two-year-old Toronto native Evan Fong is about to crack the Top 25 list for most YouTube subscribers, passing Ellen DeGeneres and Justin Bieber. And he&#8217;ll do it by playing video games. Approaching 11 million subscribers and [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 14 Jan 2015 22:45:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10729440.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10728647</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/coming+North+America+features+enhanced+processing/10728647/story.html</link><title>New 3DS XL coming out Feb. 13 in North America, features enhanced 3D and processing</title><description>On Wednesday during the company&#8217;s latest&#160;online press conference, Nintendo revealed the U.S. release date for the North American New 3DS XL, Feb. 13, the same date as the console&#8217;s European release. The new handheld is set to be more powerful [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 23:36:13 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10728648.png" type="image/png" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10716153</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/most+anticipated+games+2015/10716153/story.html</link><title>7 most anticipated video games of 2015</title><description>What games are there to look forward to in the coming year? Turns out there are quite a few. 2015 is set to feature a barrage of unique games, as well as some of the first titles developed from the [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 09 Jan 2015 21:46:34 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10716154.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10712845</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/million+prize+money+grabs+upcoming+Call+Duty+Advanced/10712845/story.html</link><title>$1-million in prize money up for grabs at upcoming Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare tournament</title><description>Next month in Los Angeles, Activision, Xbox, Major League Gaming (MLG) and Sledgehammer Games, are hosting a Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare tournament featuring the world&#8217;s top 32 Call of Duty teams, all competing to take home a $1-million prize [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 09 Jan 2015 04:24:28 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10375584.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10703915</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/PlayStation+sells+million+consoles+worldwide+million/10703915/story.html</link><title>PlayStation 4 sells 18.5 million consoles worldwide, 4.1 million during the holiday season</title><description>According to a recent press release from Sony, the company&#8217;s newest game console has sold 18.5 million units worldwide. 4.1 million of these sales occurred during the 2014 holiday shopping season between Nov. 23, 2014 and Jan. 4, 2015. Sony&#8217;s [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Tue, 06 Jan 2015 02:29:17 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10703916.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10703571</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Microsoft+gives+Xbox+more+power+limiting+Kinect/10703571/story.html</link><title>Microsoft gives Xbox One more CPU power by limiting Kinect functionality</title><description>A recent information leak perpetrated by the hacking group H4LT, has revealed information about the Xbox One&#8217;s development kit that could explain why certain recent multi-platform third-party video games performing better on the console than the PlayStation 4. According to [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Tue, 06 Jan 2015 02:38:52 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10703572.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10703289</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/PlayStation+offers+Netflix+like+subscription+streaming/10703289/story.html</link><title>PlayStation Now offers a Netflix-like subscription streaming service for games in U.S.</title><description>Tamara Sestanj Netflix-like subscription streaming services aren&#8217;t just for watching TV shows and movies anymore. Sony announced Monday that it will be offering its PlayStation Now streaming service for video games as an 100-game-inclusive subscription. Details about a Canadian release [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Mon, 05 Jan 2015 21:17:24 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10703290.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10697366</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Releasing+unfinished+video+games+become+normal/10697366/story.html</link><title>Releasing unfinished video games has become the new normal</title><description>Over the course of 2014 purchasing a video game, popping it into your shiny new Xbox One or PlayStation 4 and then actually being able to play it, became a more difficult task than it should be. Today&#8217;s modern video [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 02 Jan 2015 23:47:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10697367.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10691223</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Video+2014+year+broken+video+games/10691223/story.html</link><title>Video: 2014 was the year of broken video games</title><description>2014 was full of broken video games including the disappointing Assassin&#8217;s Creed Unity, Driveclub and even Halo: The Master Chief Collection. This is just a small selection of the many broken video games that were likely released a little too [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 31 Dec 2014 21:44:41 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10378503.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10690844</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Mega+founder+Dotcom+helped+stop+holiday+Xbox+Live+DDoS/10690844/story.html</link><title>How Kim Dotcom helped stop holiday Xbox Live and PSN DDoS attacks</title><description>Over the Christmas Holidays a&#160;loosely organized group of hackers known as Lizard Squad took down Microsoft&#8217;s online gaming service, Xbox Live (XBL), as well as Sony&#8217;s online gaming platform, PlayStation Network (PSN), through coordinated denial-of-service attacks (DDoS). But thanks to [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 31 Dec 2014 21:44:34 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10690845.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10690632</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/need+stop+ordering+video+games/10690632/story.html</link><title>Why you need to stop pre-ordering video games</title><description>Today&#8217;s pressure to pre-order games, applied by both retailers and publishers alike,&#160;does very little to serve the consumer. The main reason people choose to pre-order their games is because they&#8217;re under the impression there&#8217;s a chance stores will run out [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 31 Dec 2014 21:44:25 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10690633.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10674099</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/things+need+know+about+Halo+Guardians+beta/10674099/story.html</link><title>5 things you need to know about Halo 5: Guardians’ beta</title><description>With 343 Industries&#8217; Halo 5: Guardians&#8217; release likely a year or more away, unlike most betas the upcoming early-access Halo 5 multiplayer really is a true work-in-progress. So why do a beta this early? 343 Industries is attempting to rebuild [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Tue, 23 Dec 2014 23:15:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10674100.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10673662</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Industries+apologizes+Master+Chief+Collection+issues/10673662/story.html</link><title>343 Industries apologizes for Master Chief Collection issues with free Halo 3: ODST remake</title><description>Halo: The Master Chief Collection has suffered a very troubled&#160;release. Since the game&#8217;s release on Nov. 11 players have experienced issues launching matchmaking multiplayer matches. Multiple patches have been pushed out by 343 Industries in an effort to rectify the [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Tue, 23 Dec 2014 03:42:57 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10211779.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10667478</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/video+games+2014/10667478/story.html</link><title>The top 7 video games of 2014</title><description>2014 was an interesting year for gaming filled with amazing, groundbreaking titles but also a number of disappointments. Great games like Forza Horizon 2, Shadow of Mordor and Sunset Overdrive were released alongside titles&#160;marred with issues like Assassin&#8217;s Creed Unity [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Wed, 31 Dec 2014 18:54:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10667607.gif" type="image/gif" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10664147</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/Media+Molecule+bringing+Tearaway+Unfolded+PlayStation/10664147/story.html</link><title>How Media Molecule is bringing Tearaway Unfolded to the PlayStation 4</title><description>Las Vegas &#8211; Back in 2013, unique PlayStation Vita title Tearaway released to rave reviews from fans and critics alike, but unfortunately the game didn&#8217;t reach the broad audience many believed it&#160;deserved since it was released for Sony&#8217;s struggling portable [&#8230;]</description><source>Technology - Games - Main</source><pubDate>Fri, 19 Dec 2014 16:23:49 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10664148.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10663145</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/technology/gaming/creators+Walking+Dead+game+making+story+focused/10663145/story.html</link><title>The creators of The Walking Dead game are making a story-focused Minecraft title</title><description>Popular open-world sandbox game Minecraft is finally getting a real story thanks to Telltale Games, the creators of the popular The Walking Dead game series. However,&#160;Minecraft: Story Mode &#8211; A Telltale Game Series, isn&#8217;t going&#160;to be part of&#160;Minecraft&#8217;s official lore.
